page.title: 17PADBURY - TRAVELLING SHOPS
page.content: Due to the decline in shops and services within a village and the generally poor quality of public transport to nearby shopping centres, there has , in recent years, been an upsurge in travelling shops and services. One mobile shop calls 3 times a week, another one calls once a week. The fresh fish van comes every Wednesday, the baker 2 or 3 times a week. The fish and chip van calls on Monday at teatime and on Friday in the evening. The icecream man calls at least once a day. Milk is delivered 5 days a week and newspapers 7. The paper boy will also call to collect your paper money so you need have no direct contact with the newsagent. There are also 2 free papers delivered weekly. The Library van calls once a fortnight, thus village life is not as isolated as it might appear.
